title: Tennis bad boy Nick Kyrgios takes a swipe rival Rafael Nadal by posting insulting video on Instagram
text:
Nick Kyrgios has taken a fresh swipe at rival Rafael Nadal by posting a video mocking the Spaniard just days after his wedding.

Nadal tied the knot with his longtime girlfriend Xisca Perelló over the weekend on the Spanish island of Mallorca.

But rather than publicly congratulate the World Number 2, Kyrgios posted a video to Instagram of him hitting the ball at Nadal's body during a Wimbledon match in July.

The tennis bad boy captioned the video with 'mood' along with a cheeky monkey emoji.

Following the grudge match - which Nadal won in four sets - Kyrgios admitted he deliberately whacked the ball at his opponent's body.

World Number 2 Rafael Nadal tied the knot with his longtime girlfriend Xisca Perelló over the weekend on the Spanish island of Mallorca

Kyrgios posted a video to Instagram of him hitting the ball at Nadal's body during a Wimbledon match in July, captioned 'Mood' with a cheeky monkey emoji

'I think he can take a ball to the chest, bro. I'm not going to apologise to him at all,' Kyrgios said at the time.

'I was going for him. Yeah, I wanted to hit him square in the chest. Like, he's got decent hands.

'I don't care. Why would I apologise? I mean, the dude has got how many slams, how much money in the bank account?'

Following Kyrgios' poorly timed Instagram post, tennis fans were quick to respond to label him 'obsessed' with Nadal.

'NK is obsessed with Rafa, I don't see any other explanation...,' one person Tweeted.

Nick Kyrgios, 24, and the Spaniard have traded barbs over the years, with Nadal accusing the Australian of 'lacking respect' earlier this year after losing to him in a match in Acapulco

'Kyrgios posting the video of him hitting the ball at Nadal with the caption 'mood' on the day Rafa got married. Blokes obsessed.,' another Tweet read.

The World Number 30 and the Spaniard have traded barbs over the years, with Nadal accusing the Australian of 'lacking respect' earlier this year after losing to him in a match in Acapulco.

It originated in February when Kyrgios beat Nadal on his way to the title, bringing out an underarm serve in the three-set win, which caused the Spaniard to accuse his opponent of lacking 'respect for the public, the rival and towards himself'.

Kyrgios branded Nadal 'super salty' in an explosive podcast after the Spaniard took exception to being under-armed during a loss to the unpredictable Australian.

The 24-year-old then dubbed Nadal's uncle Toni 'an idiot' after being accused of being uneducated and lacking respect for his tour rivals.

'I can't wait. As soon as the draw came out, I was super happy that I saw him in my section,' Kyrgios said after his round-one victory.

'When you're a kid, you want to play the best players in the world on, I think it's the best court in the world.
description: Rather than congratulate Rafael Nadal for his recent wedding, Kyrgios posted a video to Instagram of him hitting the ball at the Spaniard's body during a Wimbledon match in July.
authors: Alana Mazzoni For Daily Mail Australia
